summary: This document contains email correspondence primarily between Jeffrey Epstein and Jes Staley, discussing communication issues and scheduling a call. The emails indicate Epstein's travel plans and mention attempts to connect with another individual, Ken. The content suggests a level of confidentiality and potential attorney-client privilege.

connections.description: Epstein and Staley are engaged in email correspondence discussing scheduling and communication.
Epstein is attempting to connect with Ken, indicating a social or professional relationship.

keyFacts: The email correspondence is dated February 9, 2011.
Jeffrey Epstein mentions he will be in New York from February 10 to February 13, 2011.
Jes Staley expresses that he has not heard back from someone named Steve regarding a matter.
The emails indicate a level of confidentiality and potential attorney-client privilege.
There are multiple email addresses associated with Jeffrey Epstein, indicating different communication methods.
